docs.snippet: If life has been dizzying for Michael Sam since announcing he would try to forge an N.F.L. career as a publicly gay man, it has been no less head-spinning for the men Sam is entrusting to manage it....
docs.lead_paragraph: If life has been dizzying for Michael Sam since announcing he would try to forge an N.F.L. career as a publicly gay man, it has been no less head-spinning for the men Sam is entrusting to manage it.
docs.abstract: Rookie sports agents Joe Barkett and Cameron Weiss have faced head-spinning challenges since their client Michael Sam announced that he would try to forge an NFL career as a publicly gay man; pair accompanied Sam to NFL combine, where they received outsize attention from media and marketers.

headline.main: Unlikely Partners: Rookie Agents and Gay Player
headline.print_headline: Unlikely Partners: Rookie Agents and Gay Player

docs.snippet: Simmons, who played three years for the Giants and went to the 1984 Super Bowl with the Redskins, kept his sexuality a secret until 1992 despite a raucous social life....
docs.lead_paragraph: Simmons, who played three years for the Giants and went to the 1984 Super Bowl with the Redskins, kept his sexuality a secret until 1992 despite a raucous social life.
docs.abstract: Roy Simmons, former offensive lineman for the New York Giants and the Washington Redskins and one of only a handful of NFL players to have said publicly during retirement that they were gay, dies at age 57.

headline.main: Roy Simmons, 57, Lineman Who Later Came Out as Gay, Dies
headline.print_headline: Roy Simmons, 57, Lineman Who Later Came Out as Gay
